markdownRemark.html:
We asked this beauty her hair care routine, she shared her hot tips for moisture + definition for loose waves.
She has a variety of textures in her hair ranging from 2b waves to 3b spirals. According to her dealing with that can be very tricky:

"This is very hard to deal with because waves need such different care compared to tighter curls.
To be honest, I‚Äôm still struggling with this, but what changed the game for me was mousse. I always shied away from it because it didn‚Äôt seem natural but it gives my loose waves the boost and hold to form curls while still moisturizing my tighter clumps.

I used to think I had to use lots of products on my hair for it to be healthy and defined. But now I find that less is more! I didn‚Äôt know it until I stopped but creams and gels weighed down my hair, even though it‚Äôs thick. With my looser texture, it just needs a little product to ensure moisture and encourage the curl, that‚Äôs what the leave-in and mousse do."

Scarlett cleanses and styles her hair with As I am Naturally Coconut Co-wash and leave-in. Co-washing is great for keeping your hair moisturized without stripping its natural oils. If you use a cleansing conditioner on your hair, you can wash it more frequently than you may when washing with shampoo, because co-washing is gentler than using harsh detergents. You should co-wash with a conditioning cleanser at least once or twice a week, depending on your texture and the amount of product you tend to style your hair with.
For deep conditioning, she likes to do DIYs homemade recipes. You can find great recipes for naturally curly hair here.

"As I Am is my favorite brand. It‚Äôs geared more towards tighter textures, but honestly, it works great for my looser curls. It's very moisturizing and always gives me good definition and smells bomb."

If someone starting their curly journey today asked you for advice, what would you say?

"I'd tell them their hair will change. I started with damaged barely 2b hair and now I have curls all over my head. Patience is key, it takes time to transition. Once I did a big chop I was able to start over, so I always recommend a chop or new haircut. Layers are great for looser patterns."

That said, don't freak out you all. Time is key. Trust your process and don't be afraid of a good haircut. üíáüí™‚úÇÔ∏è

product1.title: Cleansing: As I Am Naturally Coconut Co-wash
product1.description: "It cleanses, moisturizes, and detangles my hair nicely. I usually use that for both shampoo and conditioner. Sometimes I switch it up and use a clarifying shampoo - honestly any with sulfates works." As I Am says this co-wash is different from any other because it contains a special blend of natural ingredients that work to promote healthy hair growth from the follicular level, and many other curly girls approve it.

product2.title: Deep conditioning: Homemade DIYs
product2.description: "I do treatments once a month, I like homemade DIYs. Sometimes I use apple cider vinegar, and for deep conditioning treatments I usually do DIYs with aloe vera, yogurt, eggs, mayo, etc."

product3.title: Styling: As I Am Naturally Coconut Leave-in and Ogx Coconut Curls Mousse
product3.description: "I section my hair and tie my bangs up. I go through and apply a cream to my hair, brush that, shake it, and scrunch in a mousse. It‚Äôs a bit hard to describe with words lol. I should also add I pineapple at night, and refresh with water every day."
